clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Oats Containing 1.4g Beta Glucan on Fecal Bacterial Population(s) and Plasma Cholesterol in Healthy Adults With Elevated Cholesterol Levels
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Oats Containing 1.4g Beta Glucan on Fecal Bacterial Population(s) and Plasma Cholesterol in Healthy Adults With Elevated Cholesterol Levels: a Randomized, Single-blind, Placebo-controlled, Cross-over Study

brief_summary.textblock: The objectives of this study are to examine fecal bacterial population(s) and plasma cholesterol levels elicited by 40g of Oats and Cream of Rice over 6 weeks.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: For each of the two periods, a hot breakfast cereal will be consumed once daily for a duration of 6 weeks each. There will be a 4 week washout period in between each test substance.

primary_outcome.description: Increase/decrease in desirable fecal bacterial groups (specifically, but not limited to, Bifidobacterium spp. and Lactobacillus/Enterococcus spp.).

secondary_outcome.description: Increase/decrease in desirable fecal bacterial groups (specifically, but not limited to, Bifidobacterium spp. and Lactobacillus/Enterococcus spp.). Increase would be better.
Bowel movements recorded in daily diary
Bristol Stool Scale, for each bowel movement, select closest appearance from chart. 7 types ranging from watery to hard lumps

Pain, discomfort, bloating & flatulence recorded using subjective GI symptom ranking questionnaire 6 point scale from none to severe for 4 measures: pain, discomfort, bloating, flatulence. No changes would be better.

intervention.description: Intervention involves consumption of one hot cereal in the beginning of each day
